item.title: Add model ##### problem
item.dc:creator: @xzorniax xzorniax
item.description:
@xzorniax wrote:

if(s.startsWith(“add model”))
{
try
{
int ModelIndex = Integer.parseInt(s.substring(10));
byte[] abyte0 = GetModel(ModelIndex);
if(abyte0 != null && abyte0.length > 0){
aClass14Array970[1].method234(abyte0.length, abyte0, (byte)2, ModelIndex);
method77(“Model: [”+ModelIndex+"] added successfully!", 0, “”, aBoolean991);
}else{
method77("Unable to find the model. "+ModelIndex, 0, “”, aBoolean991);
}
}
catch(Exception e)
{
method77("Syntax - ::add model ", 0, “”, aBoolean991);}
}

item.title: Add model ##### problem
item.dc:creator: @l0gin1 l0gin.
item.description:
@l0gin1 wrote:

normally it should load them from a the folder called “model” where the rest of your classes are so that’s strange

you sure the file is in that folder?

and if it isnt then maybe in client.java you can search for “gz” and it’ll show you where it is trying to load them from

item.title: Add model ##### problem
item.dc:creator: @xzorniax xzorniax
item.description:
@xzorniax wrote:

So, im running a 317 client and source. It is allstar, but dont flame, i work best with allstar. ;D But moving on, whenever i add the .gz files of model, and the ints to class8, and compile, i do add model (The id of the gz model) and it says it cant find it. Any advice? I cant find where the add model command is located either…
Thats what i could find…
if(s.startsWith(“add model”))
{
try
{
int ModelIndex = Integer.parseInt(s.substring(10));
byte[] abyte0 = GetModel(ModelIndex);
if(abyte0 != null && abyte0.length > 0){
aClass14Array970[1].method234(abyte0.length, abyte0, (byte)2, ModelIndex);
method77(“Model: [”+ModelIndex+"] added successfully!", 0, “”, aBoolean991);
}else{
method77("Unable to find the model. "+ModelIndex, 0, “”, aBoolean991);
}
}
catch(Exception e)
{
method77("Syntax - ::add model ", 0, “”, aBoolean991);}
}
